column2: Your longships are burdened by the weight of fresh captives and your hirdmen adorn their armor with trophies of the slaughter.  After reducing the heretic capital of Rome to a broken, screaming, mess, you take a look around at what remains.
There must be more loot. Your party motions towards the cathedrals.

You find an altar at the far end of the crumbling corridor, barely recognizable from the fire that coated it not an hour before.  Behind this charred altar, in the stained-glass ash, you find a lustrous chalice.

The populace of the great city is dead, dying, or scattered to the countryside.  Through the fires, you spot a few men in gold-lined robes seemingly untouched by the cataclysm.  When you approach, they scream in tounges you don't understand.  You grab the most guilded of them and kill the rest.
